docs.lead_paragraph: A decision to retire by Ben Nelson, the embattled two-term Democrat from Nebraska, helps Republicans in an effort to bring the Senate under their control.

headline.seo: Ben Nelson, Nebraska Senator, Will Not Seek Re-election
headline.main: Nelson to Quit the Senate, Giving G.O.P. an Advantage
headline.print_headline: Nelson to Quit The Senate, Giving G.O.P. An Advantage

docs.abstract: Senator Ben Nelson, embattled two-term Democrat from Nebraska, announces that he will not seek re-election in 2012, giving Republicans a decided advantage in their drive to win his Senate seat and a leg up in their effort to bring the Senate under Republican control.
docs.snippet: A decision to retire by Ben Nelson, the embattled two-term Democrat from Nebraska, helps Republicans in an effort to bring the Senate under their control.

docs.lead_paragraph: This year there have been 42 health care related transactions in New York City totaling more than 1.2 million square feet.

headline.seo: Changes in Health Care Delivery Prompt Property Deals
headline.main: Shifts in Health Care Delivery Stimulate a String of Property Deals
headline.print_headline: Shifts in Health Care Delivery Stimulate a String of Property Deals

docs.abstract: Shifts in health care delivery are stimulating flurry of real estate deals; in 2011 there have been 42 health care related transactions in New York City totaling more than 1.2 million square feet.
docs.snippet: This year there have been 42 health care related transactions in New York City totaling more than 1.2 million square feet.

docs.lead_paragraph: 9:38 p.m. | Updated A nursing strike has been averted at two of Manhattan's busiest hospital centers, as union and hospital negotiators reached tentative deals over pay and benefits, officials involved in the talks said Tuesday. The 1,300 nurses at St. Luke's-Roosevelt Hospital Center had given notice they would strike on Jan. 3 but were able to resolve disagreements over health benefits. Officials at Mount Sinai Medical Center said Tuesday that they, too, had reached a tentative settlement with the nurses' union, though details of the deal were not available.

headline.main: Deals Avert Walkouts By Nurses At 2 Centers

docs.abstract: Nursing strike is averted at St. Luke's-Roosevelt Hospital Center and Mount Sinai Medical Center, two of Manhattan's busiest hospital centers, as union and hospital negotiators reach tentative deals over pay and benefits. (M)1

headline.print_headline: Deals Avert Walkouts By Nurses At 2 Centers

docs.snippet: The deals would avoid nurses' strikes at St. Luke's-Roosevelt and Mount Sinai and would allow both sides to claim victory.

headline.main: Gains in Colon Cancer Show a Racial Gap

docs.abstract: Advances in screening, diagnosis and treatment of colon cancer mean fewer people are dying of the disease today than they were 20 years ago. But black and white patients are not benefiting equally.
docs.snippet: Advances in screening, diagnosis and treatment of colon cancer mean fewer people are dying of the disease today than they were 20 years ago. But black and white patients are not benefiting equally.

docs.lead_paragraph: Advances in screening, diagnosis and treatment of colon cancer mean fewer people are dying of the disease today than they were 20 years ago. But not everyone is benefiting equally.

headline.main: Gingrich Once Sided With Romney on Health Care

docs.abstract: Newt Gingrich's apparent past support of the Massachusetts health care plan removes one arrow from his quiver as he takes aim at Mitt Romney in the last week before the Iowa caucuses.
docs.snippet: Newt Gingrich's apparent past support of the Massachusetts health care plan removes one arrow from his quiver as he takes aim at Mitt Romney in the last week before the Iowa caucuses.

docs.lead_paragraph: Before Newt Gingrich was locked in a bitter rivalry with Mitt Romney for the Republican nomination, he offered high praise for the health care law that Mr. Romney signed in 2006 as Massachusetts governor.

headline.main: Gingrich Once Sided With Romney on Health Care

docs.lead_paragraph: A 13 percent cut in health care spending as part of widespread austerity measures has left public hospitals lacking personnel and supplies, and many Greeks without care.

headline.seo: Greeks Reeling From Health Care Cutbacks
headline.main: Fiscal Crisis Takes Toll on Health of Greeks
headline.print_headline: Fiscal Crisis Takes Toll On Health Of Greeks

docs.abstract: Greece's 13 percent cut in health care spending as part of widespread austerity measures has left public hospitals lacking personnel and supplies, and many Greeks without care.
docs.snippet: A 13 percent cut in health care spending as part of widespread austerity measures has left public hospitals lacking personnel and supplies, and many Greeks without care.
